pullRequest.body:
The original `EllipticCurve` is `WeierstrassCurve` bundled with `Δ' : Rˣ` and a proof that `Δ' = Δ`. This definition makes `Δ'` and `j` computable, but at the expense that some APIs must be duplicated for `EllipticCurve` and `WeierstrassCurve`.

This PR adds the typeclass `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic` which asserts that `IsUnit W.Δ`, and which is a `Prop`. The old API for elliptic curves are replaced by a `WeierstrassCurve` `W` together with `[W.IsElliptic]`. The caveat is that `Δ'` and `j` becomes noncomputable.

The original design of this PR is `WeierstrassCurve.Elliptic` which is `Invertible W.Δ`, and which is a `Type`. By this design `Δ'` and `j` remain computable. But this design makes simpNF linter timeout. So this design is abandoned and replaced by current design.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Discussions:

https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/thoughts.20on.20elliptic.20curves/near/432354438

https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/thoughts.20on.20elliptic.20curves/near/473423362

### PR summary [449f2e2ed7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18531/commits/449f2e2ed79761b2b43bb7909f72976a331634ab)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsElliptic`
`+ coe_Δ'`
`+ instance (j : R) [h1 : Fact (IsUnit j)] [h2 : Fact (IsUnit (j - 1728))] :`
`+ instance : (W.map φ).IsElliptic := by`
`+ instance : (W.variableChange C).IsElliptic := by`
`+ instance : (ofJ j).IsElliptic := by`
`+ instance : Inhabited { W : WeierstrassCurve F // W.IsElliptic } := ⟨⟨ofJ 37, inferInstance⟩⟩`
`+ instance [hu : Fact (IsUnit (2 : R))] : (ofJ1728 R).IsElliptic := by`
`+ instance [hu : Fact (IsUnit (3 : R))] : (ofJ0 R).IsElliptic := by`
`+ inv_map_Δ'`
`+ inv_variableChange_Δ'`
`+ isUnit_Δ`
`+ j_ne_zero_of_isCharThreeJNeZeroNF_of_char_three`
`+ j_ne_zero_of_isCharTwoJNeZeroNF_of_char_two`
`+ j_of_isCharThreeJNeZeroNF_of_char_three`
`+ j_of_isCharTwoJEqZeroNF`
`+ j_of_isCharTwoJEqZeroNF_of_char_two`
`+ j_of_isCharTwoJNeZeroNF_of_char_two`
`+ j_of_isShortNF`
`+ j_of_isShortNF_of_char_three`
`+ map_Δ'`
`+ ofJNe0Or1728`
`+ ofJNe0Or1728_c₄`
`+ ofJNe0Or1728_j`
`+ ofJNe0Or1728_Δ`
`+ twoTorsionPolynomial_disc_ne_zero_of_isElliptic`
`+ variableChange_Δ'`
`+ Δ'`
`+-- twoTorsionPolynomial_disc_ne_zero`
`- EllipticCurve`
`- EllipticCurve.toAffine`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isCharNeTwoNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isCharThreeNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isCharTwoNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isShortNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_ne_zero_of_isCharThreeJNeZeroNF_of_char_three`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_ne_zero_of_isCharTwoJNeZeroNF_of_char_two`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharThreeJNeZeroNF_of_char_three`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharTwoJEqZeroNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharTwoJEqZeroNF_of_char_two`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharTwoJNeZeroNF_of_char_two`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isShortNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isShortNF_of_char_three`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharThreeNF_spec_of_b₂_eq_zero`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharThreeNF_spec_of_b₂_ne_zero`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharTwoJEqZeroNF_spec`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharTwoJNeZeroNF_spec`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toShortNFOfCharThree_spec`
`- baseChange`
`- ext`
`- instInhabitedEllipticCurve`
`- instMulActionVariableChange`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharNeTwoNF_spec :`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharThreeNF_spec :`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharTwoNF_spec [DecidableEq F] :`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toShortNF_spec : (E.variableChange E.toShortNF).IsShortNF`
`- map`
`- map_injective`
`- ofJ'`
`- ofJ'_j`
`- ofJ0`
`- ofJ1728`
`- ofJ_c₄`
`- ofJ_Δ`
`- toWeierstrassCurve_injective`
`- variableChange`
`- variableChange_comp`
`- variableChange_id`
`-+- ofJ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (2.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5033|-2|porting notes|

Current commit [449f2e2ed7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/449f2e2ed79761b2b43bb7909f72976a331634ab)
Reference commit [a2a544ab0c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/a2a544ab0cc7d3e1d2a07cda2e9dedef8dbe0749)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I've tested that `Elliptic : Type` -> `IsElliptic : Prop` and which eliminates the mysterious timeout error. At the expense that `Δ'` and `j` being noncomputable...

Note that the `Invertible` instance is still used, which contains data... Next step maybe we want to replaced them by `IsUnit` which contains no data, but for now `IsUnit` is not an instance... so I think this is related to #17458 ...

> One overarching question: do we want to stick with the variable `W : WeierstrassCurve` when we have `[W.IsElliptic]`? Should we instead use `E : WeierstrassCurve`?

It doesn't matter for me. Mostly because that's just one `W : WeierstrassCurve` across whole file, and in some sections there are `variable [W.IsElliptic]`. If in the beginning it's required to be `IsElliptic`, then I think it's fine to use `E` instead (e.g. in `J.lean`).

> I wasn't aware of the existence of `J.lean`

It's introduced in #17431.

> Do you think it could be better to move everything in `ModelsWithJ` there?

Note that that file imports `Mathlib.FieldTheory.IsSepClosed` as well as `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.NormalForms`, which is not needed by `ModelsWithJ`.

Originally the `ModelsWithJ` is introduced to generalize `Inhabited (EllipticCurve Rat)` to any field. The original result is in `Weierstrass` so the `ModelsWithJ` is also in `Weierstrass`. But now since we don't have `EllipticCurve` anymore, so I think it's OK to move them to another file. Probably a new file `ModelsWithJ.lean` but not `J.lean`.
Done for most suggestions.

I wasn't aware of the existence of `J.lean`, so I'll mostly comment on `Weierstrass.lean`.

Do you think it could be better to move everything in `ModelsWithJ` there?

Thanks - this is wonderful and very welcome! I added a few comments and will continue with the reviews once I have more time in a few days.

One overarching question: do we want to stick with the variable `W : WeierstrassCurve` when we have `[W.IsElliptic]`? Should we instead use `E : WeierstrassCurve`?

I wasn't aware of the existence of `J.lean`, so I'll mostly comment on `Weierstrass.lean`.

Do you think it could be better to move everything in `ModelsWithJ` there?
Which is preferable? If you prefer this, can you do the same for lines 14-15 in `Group.lean`?

Please note that `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.Group` is not working in this case; see https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/Affine.html .

> can you do the same for lines 14-15 in `Group.lean`?

Sure.
Yeah, I am very aware of this annoying bug in the docs! Do you have any idea why?

According to https://github.com/leanprover/doc-gen4/blob/b6ae1cf11e83d972ffa363f9cdc8a2f89aaa24dc/DocGen4/Output/DocString.lean#L68-L100 the only correct way to reference file is write its filename (line 76-77), otherwise it only works if the file referenced is already `import`ed by current file (line 82-84).

> can you do the same for lines 14-15 in `Group.lean`?

The line break in that file is too tight. 🤦‍♂️ Since it's working, I'll not change them.

I think this works?
```
under the geometric group law defined in `Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/Affine.lean` and
in `Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/Jacobian.lean`.
```
In any case, I guess don't worry too much about it because they will all be refactored eventually (hopefully soon).
Ah yes that works. I mean the other one at L20 is tough.

```suggestion
/-- `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic` is a typeclass which asserts that a Weierstrass curve is an
elliptic curve: that its discriminant is a unit. Note that this definition is only mathematically
accurate for certain rings whose Picard group has trivial 12-torsion, such as a field or a PID. -/
```
I guess you can leave all the `twoTorsionPolynomial` lemmas as they are: they will be deprecated soon.
OK 😂 Is it OK to just leave comments here, and then removed once these become deprecated?
Yeah, that's fine too.

I don't think you need name this instance - you don't refer to it, and its generated name is sensible.

Same with all the other instances below of the form `IsElliptic.*`: I'm trying to discourage the suggestive namespace `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic`.
Done.

One line:
```suggestion
  simp only [isElliptic_iff, map_Δ, W.isUnit_Δ.map]
```

Maybe:
```suggestion
  rw [coe_Δ', map_Δ, coe_Δ']
```

```suggestion
lemma map_Δ' : (W.map φ).Δ' = Units.map φ W.Δ' := by
  ext
  exact W.coe_map_Δ' φ
```

Add this?
```
set_option linter.docPrime false in
@[simp]
lemma inv_map_Δ' : (W.map φ).Δ'⁻¹ = Units.map φ W.Δ'⁻¹ := by
  ext
  exact W.coe_inv_map_Δ' φ
```
Thanks! Done.

```suggestion
  rw [j, coe_inv_map_Δ', map_c₄, j, map_mul, map_pow]
```
Shall we wait until #17458 is merged before continuing on this PR?
I don't know how long will #17458 will be merged. I think it should be easy to fix for them if our PR is merged first.
Sorry, I just got back to this. Once that is merged, the suggestions I have below will be drastically different.
These and the lemmas below can be stated in fewer lines, since we no longer need `invertibleOfNonzero`.
Yes, not all of the following lemmas are needed, but I don't know how to state the definition `ofJ` in fewer lines; do you mean fold `if ... then ... else` into one line?
Yeah that's what I'm thinking. The statements of the other lemmas can each be one line.
Done.

Ditto as above:
```suggestion
instance : Inhabited { W : WeierstrassCurve F // W.IsElliptic } :=
```

Should we use `(h3 : (3 : F) ≠ 0)` instead? I don't quite remember why we did this instead.

Otherwise, we can also make the assumptions below `[CharP F 3]` etc, but we should be consistent.

> Should we use `(h3 : (3 : F) ≠ 0)` instead? I don't quite remember why we did this instead.

It's here https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/5935#discussion_r1280637704

I think it's OK to revert to `(h3 : (3 : F) ≠ 0)` since otherwise it looks like that we are abusing instances.

```suggestion
  rw [ofJ, if_pos <| by linear_combination 576 * h3, if_pos h3]
```

```suggestion
  · exact ofJ_1728_of_three_eq_zero h3
  · rw [ofJ, show (1728 : F) = 2 ^ 6 * 3 ^ 3 by norm_num1,
      if_neg <| mul_ne_zero (pow_ne_zero 6 h2.out) (pow_ne_zero 3 h3), if_pos rfl]
```

```suggestion
  rw [ofJ, if_pos <| by linear_combination 864 * h2,
```
All the `haveI` can be replaced by `have`. Once we replace `Fact (IsUnit ...)` with `IsUnit ...`, and once we decide on whether to remove `NeZero`, most of these should be a lot cleaner to prove.
I just get used to write `haveI` for instances instead of `have`. Anyways, I'll change them.

With the prime linter, I think we should try to rename this? What do you think of calling one of them `disc`, and keep the other one `Δ`? The one that's used more often should be `Δ`, but I'm not sure which.
I don't know. Maybe we should leave this for another PR. Changing `Δ'` to something else requires altering some of existing code using `Δ'`.

```suggestion
 * `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic`: typeclass asserting that a Weierstrass curve is an elliptic curve.
```

pullRequest.title: refactor(AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/*): add `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic` and remove `EllipticCurve`
